Name: 2D wind speed and direction
Description: Two-dimensional wind speed and direction, available as two- and thirty-minute aggregations of 1 Hz observations.  Observations are made by 2-D sonic anemometer sensors located at multiple heights on the tower infrastructure and by 2-D sonic anemometer sensors located on the aquatic meteorological station.

Name: 3D wind attitude and motion reference
Description: Measurement of 3D anemometer attitude and motion.

Name: 3D wind speed, direction and sonic temperature
Description: Three-dimensional windspeed and direction measured by sonic anemometer; air temperature measured by the 3-D sonic anemometer.

Name: Air temperature above water on-buoy
Description: Air temperature, available as one- and thirty-minute averages. Observations are made on the meteorology station on the buoy in lakes and rivers.

Name: Albedo - spectrometer - flightline
Description: Total amount of solar radiation in the 0.4 to 2.5 micron band reflected by the Earth surface into an upward hemisphere divided by the total amount incident from this hemisphere; data are provided by flightline

Name: Albedo - spectrometer - mosaic
Description: Total amount of solar radiation in the 0.4 to 2.5 micron band reflected by the Earthâ€™s surface into an upward hemisphere divided by the total amount incident from this hemisphere

Name: Aquatic plant bryophyte chemical properties
Description: Carbon (C) and nitrogen (N) concentrations of aquatic plant and bryophytes from benthic collections in lakes, non-wadeable streams, and wadeable streams

Name: Aquatic plant bryophyte macroalgae clip harvest
Description: Dry weight of aquatic plant, bryophyte, and macroalgae from benthic quadrats in lakes, non-wadeable streams, and wadeable streams

Name: Aquatic plant, bryophyte, lichen, and macroalgae point counts in wadeable streams
Description: Point counts of aquatic plants, bryophytes, lichens, and macroalgae from transects in wadeable streams

Name: Atmospheric CO2 isotopes
Description: Profile measurements of CO2 isotope concentration, 13C stable isotope ratio in CO2, and water vapor concentration at each tower level.

Name: Atmospheric H2O isotopes
Description: Profile measurements of water vapor isotope concentration, 18O and 2H stable isotope ratio in water vapor at each tower level.

Name: Barometric pressure
Description: Barometric pressure is available as one- and thirty-minute averages for station pressure, which is determined from 0.1 Hz observations. Barometric pressure corrected to sea level and surface level (defined as water surface at aquatic sites and soil surface at terrestrial sites) is derived from station pressure averages and available at one- and thirty-minute increments. Observations are made by a single digital barometer located on the tower infrastructure and a single digital barometer located on the aquatic meteorological station.

Name: Barometric pressure above water on-buoy
Description: Barometric pressure, available as one- and thirty-minute averages for both station pressure and pressure reduced to sea level. Observations are made on the meteorology station on the buoy in lakes and rivers.

Name: Bathymetric and morphological maps
Description: Bathymetry of lake bottoms and non-wadeable streams for detecting environmental change as well as for determining lake morphology, estimating primary productivity, habitat features, and water quality.

Name: Benthic microbe community composition
Description: Counts and relative abundances of archaeal, bacterial, and fungal taxa observed in benthic microbial communities

Name: Benthic microbe group abundances
Description: Counts and relative abundances of marker genes from total archaea, bacteria, and fungi observed by qPCR in benthic microbial communities

Name: Benthic microbe marker gene sequences
Description: DNA sequence data from ribosomal RNA marker genes from benthic samples

Name: Benthic microbe metagenome sequences
Description: Metagenomic sequence data from benthic samples

Name: Breeding landbird point counts
Description: Count, distance from observer, and taxonomic identification of breeding landbirds observed during point counts

Name: Bundled data products - eddy covariance
Description: Bundle of eddy-covariance data products, including related meteorological and soil data products.

Name: Canopy lignin - flightline
Description: Normalized index of canopy lignin concentration; data are provided by flightline

Name: Canopy lignin - mosaic
Description: Normalized index of canopy lignin concentration. Level 2 products derived from individual flight lines over a given site are mosaiced into single product; spatial resolution is 1m.

Name: Canopy nitrogen - flightline
Description: Normalized difference nitrogen index (NDNI) from remotely sensed data; data are provided by flightline

Name: Canopy nitrogen - mosaic
Description: Measure of canopy nitrogen concentration in remotely sensed data. Level 2 products derived from individual flight lines over a given site are mosaicked into single product; spatial resolution is 1m.

Name: Canopy water content - flightline
Description: Normalized index of canopy water content; data are provided by flightline

Name: Canopy water content - mosaic
Description: Normalized index of canopy water content. Level 2 products derived from individual flight lines over a given site are mosaicked into single product; spatial resolution is 1m.

Name: Canopy xanthophyll cycle - flightline
Description: Normalized index of  xanthophyll concentration; data are provided by flightline

Name: Canopy xanthophyll cycle - mosaic
Description: Normalized index of  xanthophyll concentration. Level 2 products derived from individual flight lines over a given site are mosaicked into single product; spatial resolution is 1m.

Name: Carbon dioxide flux
Description: Carbon dioxide flux of CO2 is estimated based on the eddy covariance technique from sonic anemometer measurements of vertical winds and an IRGA measurement of CO2 concentration and tower profile measurements of CO2 concentration.

Name: Chemical properties of groundwater
Description: Grab samples of groundwater chemistry including general chemistry, anions, cations, and nutrients.

Name: Chemical properties of surface water
Description: Grab samples of surface water chemistry including general chemistry, anions, cations, and nutrients.

Name: CO2 concentration - storage
Description: Concentration of CO2 in profile of tower; used in calculation of storage terms in eddy covariance calculations of carbon exchange.

Name: CO2 concentration - turbulent
Description: Concentration of CO2 at the top of the tower; used in calculation of turbulent terms in eddy covariance calculations of carbon exchange.

Name: CO2 concentration rate of change
Description: Time rate of change of CO2 concentration (storage component only) over 30 minutes at each measurement level along the vertical tower profile. Gap-filling is not applicable.

Name: CO2 concentration rate of change profile
Description: Time rate of change of CO2 concentration (storage component only) over 30 min, spatially interpolated along the vertical tower profile.

Name: Coarse downed wood bulk density sampling
Description: Raw bulk density measurements of coarse downed wood >= 2 cm diameter

Name: Coarse downed wood log survey
Description: Tally and raw measurement of coarse downed wood >= 2 cm diameter

Name: Depth profile at specific depths
Description: Measurements of water column temperature and depth profile in non-wadeable streams and lakes

Name: Digital hemispheric photos of plot vegetation
Description: Upward and/or downward facing digital 180-degree images of vegetation in plots used to calculate leaf area index

Name: Discrete return LiDAR point cloud
Description: Unclassified three-dimensional point cloud stored in LAS format. Classifications follow ASPRS definition. All point coordinates are provided in meters. Data provided by flightline.

Name: Dissolved gases in surface water
Description: Grab samples of surface water dissolved gases including carbon dioxide, methane, and nitrous oxide

Name: Dust and particulate size distribution
Description: Near real-time measurements of PM1.0, PM2.5, PM4, PM10, PM15 and TSP in the atmosphere using a optical sensor.

Name: Ecosystem structure
Description: Height of the top of canopy above bare earth (Canopy Height Model (CHM));  data are mosaicked over AOP footprint; mosaicked onto a spatially uniform grid at 1 m spatial resolution in 1 km by 1 km tiles.

Name: Elevation - LiDAR
Description: Bare earth elevation given in meters above mean sea level (topographic information with vegetation and man-made structures removed) and mosaicked onto a spatially uniform grid at 1 m spatial resolution in 1 km by 1 km tiles. Surface features given in meters above mean sea level (topographic information with vegetation and man-made structures removed) and mosaicked onto a spatially uniform grid at 1 m spatial resolution in 1 km by 1 km tiles.

Name: Elevation of groundwater
Description: Sensor based measurement of groundwater elevation calculated from pressure transducer readings in each well

Name: Elevation of surface water
Description: Measurements of water surface elevation, available as one-, five-, and thirty-minute  averages in lakes and wadeable streams. Based on sensor measurements of water pressure.

Name: Field spectral data
Description: Reflectance of collected sample(s) using leaf clip and hand-held field Spectrometer; opportunistic product, provided when collected.

Name: Fish electrofishing, gill netting, and fyke netting counts
Description: Counts of fish from electrofishing surveys in wadeable streams, or electrofishing, gill netting, and/or fyke netting surveys in lakes. Includes fish standard length and individual mass

Name: Fish sequences DNA barcode
Description: CO1 DNA sequences from select fish in lakes and wadeable streams

Name: Flux footprint characteristics
Description: The eddy-covariance flux measurement sources its information from an upstream surface, the footprint. Footprint characteristics provide the biophysical surface information of this time-varying area, necessary to distinguish temporal effects (e.g., biological activity) from spatial effects (e.g., changing wind direction).

Name: fPAR - spectrometer - flightline
Description: The fraction of incident photosynthetically active radiation (400-700 nm) absorbed by the green elements of a vegetation canopy; calculated by an industry standard (ATCOR) algorithm based on Soil Adjusted Vegetation Index (SAVI) as input; data are provided by flightline at equivalent resolution to spectrometer orthorectified surface directional reflectance, carbon and nutrient cycling due to its relationship with vegetative productivity.

Name: fPAR - spectrometer - mosaic
Description: The fraction of incident photosynthetically active radiation (400-700 nm) absorbed by the green elements of a vegetation canopy; mosaiced from the fPAR level 2 product onto a spatially uniform grid at 1 m spatial resolution and provided as 1 km by 1 km tiles.

Name: Gauge height
Description: Gauge height, in meters, measured at lakes, wadeable streams and non-wadeable streams.

Name: Ground beetle sequences DNA barcode
Description: CO1 DNA sequences from select ground beetles

Name: Ground beetles sampled from pitfall traps
Description: Taxonomically identified ground beetles and the plots and times from which they were collected.

Name: Groundwater and active layer measurements at permafrost sites
Description: Measurements from ground surface to liquid groundwater and active layer thaw. Collected at sites with permafrost.

Name: H2O concentration - storage
Description: Concentration of H2O in profile; used in calculation of storage terms in eddy covariance calculations of water vapor exchange.

Name: H2O concentration - turbulent
Description: Concentration of H2O at the top of the tower; used in calculation of  turbulent terms in eddy covariance calculations of water vapor exchange.

Name: H2O concentration rate of change
Description: Time rate of change of H2O concentration (storage component only) over 30 minutes at each measurement level along the vertical tower profile. Gap-filling is not applicable.

Name: H2O concentration rate of change profile
Description: Time rate of change of H2O concentration (storage component only) over 30 min, spatially interpolated along the vertical tower profile.

Name: Herbaceous clip harvest
Description: Dry weight of herbaceous vegetation harvested from individual clip strips, by functional type

Name: High-resolution orthorectified camera imagery
Description: White balanced 8 bit RGB images orthorectified and output onto a fixed, uniform spatial grid using nearest neighbor resampling to a 10 cm spatial resolution.

Name: High-resolution orthorectified camera imagery mosaic
Description: Level 1 high-resolution orthorectified camera images are mosaiced and tiled into 1 km by 1 km data sets. Mosiac is output onto a fixed, uniform spatial grid using nearest-neighbor resampling; spatial resolution is maintained at 0.1 m.

Name: IR biological temperature
Description: Infrared temperature, available as one- and thirty-minute averages of 1 Hz observations.  Biological temperature (i.e. surface temperature) is measured via IR temperature sensors located in the soil array and at multiple heights on the tower infrastructure.

Name: LAI - spectrometer - flightline
Description: The ratio of upper leaf surface area to ground area (for broadleaf canopies), or projected conifer needle surface area to ground area (for coniferous plants) for a given unit area; measured by an industry standard (ATCOR) algorithm based on Soil Adjusted Vegetation Index (SAVI) as input; data are provided by flightline.

Name: LAI - spectrometer - mosaic
Description: The ratio of upper leaf surface area to ground area (for broadleaf canopies), or projected conifer needle surface area to ground area (for coniferous plants) for a given unit area; Level 2 products derived from individual flight lines over a given site are mosaiced into single product; spatial resolution is 1m.

Name: Land-water interface images
Description: RGB and IR images of the lake, river, or stream riparian vegetation and stream surface taken from an automated camera. Images are collected every 15 minutes.

Name: Latent heat flux
Description: Latent heat flux is estimated based on the eddy covariance technique using a sonic anemometer to measure vertical winds and an IRGA sensor to measure water vapor and tower profile measurements of water vapor.

Name: LiDAR slant range waveform
Description: Outgoing pulse and slant range return waveform signals with geolocation information provided, but no spatial resampling. Data are provided by flightline in a binary format designed by NEON.

Name: Litter chemical properties
Description: Bulk litter chemistry at the scale of a plot. Data are reported by functional group (leaves vs. needles).

Name: Litter stable isotopes
Description: Bulk litter stable isotope values at the scale of a plot. Data are reported by functional group (leaves vs. needles).

Name: Litterfall and fine woody debris sampling
Description: Dry weight of litterfall and fine woody debris collected from elevated litter traps and ground traps, by functional group

Name: Macroinvertebrate collection
Description: Collection of benthic macroinvertebrates using multiple sampling methods in lakes, non-wadeable streams, and wadeable streams

Name: Macroinvertebrate metabarcoding
Description: CO1 DNA sequences of the aquatic macroinvertebrate community

Name: Momentum flux
Description: Momentum flux is estimated based on the eddy covariance technique using a sonic anemometer to measure vertical and horizontal winds.

Name: Mosquito sequences DNA barcode
Description: CO1 DNA sequences from select mosquitoes

Name: Mosquito-borne pathogen status
Description: Presence/absence of a pathogen in a single mosquito sample (pool)

Name: Mosquitoes sampled from CO2 traps
Description: Taxonomically identified mosquitoes and the plots and times from which they were collected

Name: Nitrate in surface water
Description: In situ sensor-based nitrate concentration, available as fifteen minute  averages in surface water in lakes, wadeable and non-wadeable streams

Name: Non-herbaceous perennial vegetation structure
Description: Field measurements of individual non-herbaceous perennial plants (e.g. cacti, ferns)

Name: Particulate mass
Description: Dust mass and density measured by a high volume dust sampler and quartz filters.

Name: Periphyton, seston, and phytoplankton chemical properties
Description: Carbon (C), nitrogen (N), phosphorus (P), isotopes, chlorophyll a, and pheophytin of periphyton, seston, and phytoplankton from benthic and water column samples in lakes, non-wadeable streams, and wadeable streams

Name: Periphyton, seston, and phytoplankton collection
Description: Collection and biomass of periphyton, seston, and phytoplankton using multiple benthic and water column sampling methods in lakes, non-wadeable streams, and wadeable streams

Name: Phenology images
Description: RGB and IR images of the plant canopy taken from an automated camera on the tower top. Images are collected every 15 minutes and closely follow protocols of the Phenocam Network.

Name: Photosynthetically active radiation (PAR)
Description: Photosynthetically Active Radiation (PAR) observations represent the radiation flux at wavelengths between 400-700 nm, which constitute the wavelengths that drive photosynthesis. This data product is available as one- and thirty-minute averages of 1 Hz observations.  Observations are made by sensors located at multiple heights on the tower infrastructure and by sensors located on the aquatic meteorological station.

Name: Photosynthetically active radiation (quantum line)
Description: The quantum line sensor provides spatially averaged observations of photosynthetically active radiation (PAR), i.e., wavelengths between 400-700 nm, at the soil surface over a one meter length. This data product is available as one- and thirty-minute averages of 1 Hz observations.  Observations are obtained by sensors located throughout the soil array.

Name: Photosynthetically active radiation at water surface
Description: Photosynthetically Active Radiation (PAR) observations represent the radiation flux at wavelengths between 400-700 nm, which constitute the wavelengths that drive photosynthesis. This data product is available as one-, five-,  and thirty-minute averages. Observations are made at the aquatic sensor set location at lakes, non-wadeable streams, and wadeable streams.

Name: Photosynthetically active radiation below water surface
Description: Photosynthetically Active Radiation (PAR) observations represent the radiation flux at wavelengths between 400-700 nm, which constitute the wavelengths that drive photosynthesis. This data product is available as one- and thirty-minute averages. Observations are made at the aquatic sensor sets at the lake inlet, lake outlet, and both lake and river buoys.

Name: Plant foliar physical and chemical properties
Description: Plant sun-lit canopy foliar physical (e.g., leaf mass per area) and chemical properties reported at the level of the individual (woody plants) or community (herbaceous plants).

Name: Plant foliar stable isotopes
Description: Plant sun-lit canopy foliar stable isotope values reported at the level of the individual (woody plants) or community (herbaceous plants).

Name: Plant phenology observations
Description: Phenophase status and intensity of tagged plants

Name: Plant presence and percent cover
Description: Plant species presence as observed in multi-scale plots: species and associated percent cover at 1-m2 and plant species presence at 10-m2, 100-m2 and 400-m2

Name: Precipitation
Description: Precipitation is observed using one of two sensors. Primary precipitation is observed using a weighing gauge housed within a small double fence intercomparison reference, which is generally located within 0.5 km of the tower infrastructure. Secondary precipitation is observed using a tipping bucket located on the top of the tower infrastructure. Ground level precipitation (also known as throughfall) is also observed using tipping buckets at 3 of 5 soil array locations. Bulk precipitation is determined at five- and thirty-minute intervals for primary precipitation and at one- and thirty-minute intervals for secondary precipitation. AIS sites only include Primary (DFIR at Core Aquatic sites; currently only 2 or 3) or Secondary (tipping buckets at relocatable sites; currently about 8). No AIS sites have both; no AIS sites have the equivalent of throughfall.

Name: Reaeration field and lab collection
Description: Field and external laboratory data from the salt-tracer and gas injection field reaeration measurements, including stream widths, inert gas concentrations, gas loss rate calculations, and travel time calculations.

Name: Relative humidity
Description: Relative humidity, temperature, and dew or frost point temperature, available as one- and thirty-minute averages of 1 Hz observations. Observations are made by sensors located at the top of the tower infrastructure, in the soil array, and on the aquatic meteorologic station.

Name: Relative humidity above water on-buoy
Description: Relative humidity, temperature, and dew or frost point temperature, available as one- and thirty-minute averages. Observations are made by sensors located on the buoy in lakes and rivers.

Name: Riparian composition and structure
Description: Assessment of riparian vegetation composition and physical structure in lakes, non-wadeable streams, and wadeable streams

Name: Riparian vegetation % cover
Description: Assessment of riparian vegetation percent cover in wadeable streams

Name: Rodent-borne pathogen status
Description: Presence/absence of a pathogen (or antibodies to a pathogen) in each single rodent sample

Name: Root chemical properties
Description: Fine root chemistry from cores or pits. Data are reported by size class.

Name: Root sampling (Megapit)
Description: Fine root biomass in 10cm increments (first 1m depth) and 20cm increments (from 1m to 2m depth) from soil pit sampling

Name: Root sampling tower plots
Description: Fine root biomass to 30cm depth via soil core sampling

Name: Root stable isotopes
Description: Fine root stable isotope values from cores or pits. Data are reported by size class.

Name: Salt-based stream discharge
Description: Discharge measured using a constant-rate addition salt tracer during reaeration measurements

Name: Secchi depth
Description: Measurement of water column Secchi depth in non-wadeable streams and lakes

Name: Sediment chemical properties
Description: Inorganic, organic, and organic contaminant analyses of wadeable stream, non-wadeable stream, and lake bed sediments

Name: Sediment physical properties
Description: Size analysis of wadeable stream, non-wadeable stream, and lake bed sediments

Name: Sensible heat flux
Description: Sensible heat flux is estimated based on the eddy covariance technique using a sonic anemometer to measure vertical winds and air temperature and tower profile measurements of air temperature.

Name: Shortwave and longwave radiation (net radiometer)
Description: Net radiation is composed of incoming and outgoing shortwave and longwave radiation. These data products are available as one- and thirty-minute averages of 1 Hz observations.  Observations of net shortwave and longwave radiation are made by a sensor located at the top of the tower infrastructure, while only net longwave radiation is observed in the soil array.  Observations of net shortwave and longwave radiation are made by a four-component sensor located on the aquatic meteorological station.

Name: Shortwave and longwave radiation above water on-buoy (net radiometer)
Description: Net shortwave and longwave radiation on buoys is measured twice per minute and is reported as 1-minute and 30-minute mean values.

Name: Shortwave radiation (direct and diffuse pyranometer)
Description: Total, direct beam, and diffuse shortwave radiation, available as one- and thirty-minute averages of 1 Hz observations.  Observations are made by a sensor located at the top of the tower infrastructure.

Name: Shortwave radiation (primary pyranometer)
Description: Total shortwave radiation, available as one- and thirty-minute averages of 1 Hz observations.  The primary pyranometer is housed in a heated and aspirated ventilation unit and observes incoming shortwave radiation at the top of the tower infrastructure.

Name: Single aspirated air temperature
Description: Air temperature, available as one- and thirty-minute averages of 1 Hz observations. Observations are made by sensors located at multiple heights on the tower infrastructure and by sensors located on the aquatic meteorological station. Temperature observations are made using platinum resistance thermometers, which are housed in a fan aspirated shield to reduce radiative bias.

Name: Site management and event reporting
Description: This data product contains records of land management activities, disturbances, and other incidents of ecological note within all NEON sites

Name: Slope and Aspect - LiDAR
Description: Slope is a ratio of rise over run (height over distance) of the bare earth elevation product given in degrees; aspect is the direction of the steepest slope of the bare earth elevation product (e.g., north, east, south, west) given in degrees clockwise from grid north; both mosaicked onto a spatially uniform grid at 1 m spatial resolution in 1 km by 1 km tiles.

Name: Small mammal box trapping
Description: Individual- and trap-level data collected using box traps designed to capture small mammals

Name: Small mammal sequences DNA barcode
Description: CO1 DNA sequences from select small mammals

Name: Snow depth and understory phenology images
Description: Camera images of snow depth relative to mounted/calibrated depth stakes when snow is present; images used to track understory phenology when possible (see NEON.DOM.SITE.DP1.00033).

Name: Soil chemical properties (Distributed initial characterization)
Description: Soil chemical properties of a soil core that was sampled by the NRCS as part of initial site characterization activities at the NEON site.  Data are reported by horizon for the top 1m of the soil profile. Also see distributed periodic and megapit soil data.

Name: Soil chemical properties (Distributed periodic)
Description: Soil chemistry from the top 30 cm of the profile from periodic soil core collections. Data are reported by horizon (mineral vs. organic). See initial characterization and megapit products for additional soil data.

Name: Soil chemical properties (Megapit)
Description: Total content of a range of chemical elements, pH, and electrical conductivity in the <= 2 mm soil fraction for each soil horizon. Data were derived from a sampling location expected to be representative of the area where the Instrumented Soil Plots per site are located and were collected once during site construction. Also see distributed soil data products.

Name: Soil CO2 concentration
Description: CO2 concentration in soil air at various depth below the soil surface starting at 2 cm. Data are from all five Instrumented Soil Plots per site and presented as 1-minute and 30-minute averages.

Name: Soil CO2 flux - MDP sensor
Description: Flux of carbon dioxide from the soil surface. Generated only by the mobile deployment platforms (MDP); for soil CO2 concentration at NEON towers see NEON.DOM.SITE.DP1.00095.

Name: Soil heat flux plate
Description: The amount of thermal energy moving by conduction across an area of soil in a unit of time. Measured as part of the soil array.

Name: Soil inorganic nitrogen pools and transformations
Description: Soil inorganic nitrogen concentrations and rates of net nitrogen mineralization and net nitrification from the top 30 cm of the profile. Data are reported by horizon (organic vs. mineral) within a soil core.

Name: Soil microbe biomass
Description: Quantitative abundance of total microbes in soil samples

Name: Soil microbe community composition
Description: Counts and relative abundances of archaeal, bacterial, and fungal taxa observed in soil microbial communities

Name: Soil microbe group abundances
Description: Counts and relative abundances of marker genes from total archaea, bacteria, and fungi observed by qPCR in soil microbial communities

Name: Soil microbe marker gene sequences
Description: DNA sequence data from ribosomal RNA marker genes from soil samples

Name: Soil microbe metagenome sequences
Description: Metagenomic sequence data from soil samples

Name: Soil physical properties (Distributed initial characterization)
Description: Soil physical properties of a soil core that was sampled by the NRCS as part of initial site characterization activities at the NEON site.  Data are reported by horizon for the top 1m of the soil profile. Also see distributed periodic and megapit soil data.

Name: Soil physical properties (Distributed periodic)
Description: Soil physical properties from the top 30 cm of the profile from periodic soil core collections. Data are reported by horizon (mineral vs. organic). See initial characterization and megapit products for additional soil data.

Name: Soil physical properties (Megapit)
Description: Soil taxonomy, horizon names, horizon depths, as well as soil bulk density and texture (sand, silt, and clay content) in the <= 2 mm soil fraction for each soil horizon. Data were derived from a sampling location expected to be representative of the area where the Instrumented Soil Plots per site are located and were collected once during site construction. Also see distributed soil data products.

Name: Soil stable isotopes (Distributed periodic)
Description: Soil stable isotope values from the top 30 cm of the profile from periodic soil core collections. Data are reported by horizon (mineral vs. organic). See initial characterization and megapit products for additional soil data.

Name: Soil temperature
Description: Temperature of the soil at various depth below the soil surface from 2 cm up to 200 cm at non-permafrost sites (up to 300 cm at Alaskan sites). Data are from all five Instrumented Soil Plots per site and presented as 1-minute and 30-minute averages.

Name: Soil water content and water salinity
Description: Soil volumetric water content and an index of salinity at various depth below the soil surface from 2 cm up to 200 cm at non-permafrost sites (up to 300 cm at Alaskan sites). Data are from all five Instrumented Soil Plots per site and presented as 1-minute and 30-minute averages.

Name: Specific conductivity in groundwater
Description: In situ sensor-based measurements of specific conductance of groundwater in wells

Name: Specific conductivity of surface water
Description: In situ sensor-based measurements of specific conductance in surface water

Name: Spectral sun photometer - calibrated sky radiances
Description: Calibrated Sky Radiances; includes Almucantar Radiance Data and Principal Plane Radiance Data.

Name: Spectrometer orthorectified surface directional reflectance - flightline
Description: Surface reflectance (0-1 unitless, scaled by 10,000) computed from the NEON Imaging Spectrometer using ATCOR4r is orthorectified and output onto a fixed, uniform spatial grid using nearest-neighbor resampling. Fixed spatial grid is based on the native spatial resolution which is driven by the aircraft altitude; data are provided by flightline.

Name: Spectrometer orthorectified surface directional reflectance - mosaic
Description: Orthorectified Surface reflectance (0-1 unitless, scaled by 10,000) computed from the NEON Imaging Spectrometer (NIS) per pixel; data are orthorectified and output onto a fixed, uniform spatial grid using nearest-neighbor resampling (tbr). Level 1 flight lines over a given site are mosaicked into single product; spatial resolution is 1m.

Name: Spectrometer orthrorectified at-sensor radiance - flightline
Description: Calibrated radiance in units of uW/cm^2-sr-nm as measured by the NEON Imaging Spectrometer is orthorectified and output onto a fixed, uniform spatial grid using nearest-neighbor resampling. Fixed spatial grid is based on the native spatial resolution which is driven by the aircraft altitude; data are provided by flightline.

Name: Stable isotope concentrations in groundwater
Description: Grab samples for stable isotopes of water in groundwater

Name: Stable isotope concentrations in precipitation
Description: Stable isotope ratios of 18O and 2H in precipitation water

Name: Stable isotope concentrations in surface waters
Description: Grab samples for stable isotope chemistry including water and organic matter, in lakes, non-wadeable streams, and wadeable streams

Name: Stream discharge
Description: Continuous measurements of stream discharge calculated from a stage-discharge rating curve and sensor-based measurements of water surface elevation.

Name: Stream discharge field collection
Description: Discharge measurements from field-based surveys

Name: Stream discharge rating curve
Description: Rating curve generated from manual wading surveys of stream discharge. Used to calculate continuous measurements of stream discharge.

Name: Stream morphology map
Description: Map showing the morphology of streams. These maps denote topography of the stream basin as well as location of the thalweg, coarse woody debris, gravel/sand bars, and other features of interest.

Name: Summary weather statistics
Description: Present summary statistics for biometeorological variables for NEON weather stations at core TIS sites. Statistics will include means, standard deviations, maxima, and minima for periods of days, months, and years. Engineering-grade product only.

Name: Surface water microbe cell count
Description: Cell counts from surface water microbial collection in lakes, wadeable streams, and non-wadeable streams

Name: Surface water microbe community composition
Description: Counts and relative abundances of archaeal, bacterial, and fungal taxa observed in surface water microbial communities in lakes, non-wadeable streams, and wadeable streams

Name: Surface water microbe group abundances
Description: Counts and relative abundances of marker genes from total archaea, bacteria, and fungi observed by qPCR in surface water microbial communities

Name: Surface water microbe marker gene sequences
Description: DNA sequence data from ribosomal RNA marker genes from surface water samples

Name: Surface water microbe metagenome sequences
Description: Metagenomic sequence data from surface water samples

Name: Temperature (digital thermistor) of surface water
Description: In situ sensor-based measurements of temperature in surface water using a digital thermistor

Name: Temperature (PRT) in surface water
Description: Surface water temperature, available as one-, five-, and thirty-minute  averages, measured by a platinum resistance thermometer at the sensor location in lakes, wadeable and non-wadeable streams

Name: Temperature at specific depth in surface water
Description: Sensor based measurements of water temperature in lake and river sites. Temperature is measured at specific depths by a fixed-length buoy-mounted array of temperature sensors.

Name: Temperature of groundwater
Description: Sensor based measurement of groundwater temperature in each well.

Name: Temperature rate of change
Description: Time rate of change of temperature (storage component only) over 30 minutes at each measurement level along the vertical tower profile. Gap-filling is not applicable.

Name: Temperature rate of change profile
Description: Time rate of change of temperature (storage component only) over 30 min, spatially interpolated along the vertical tower profile.

Name: Temporally interpolated biological temperature
Description: Temporally interpolated (i.e., to gap fill missing data) biological temperature (i.e. surface temperature) measured via IR temperature sensors located in the soil array and at multiple heights on the tower infrastructure.

Name: Temporally interpolated PAR-line
Description: Temporally interpolated (i.e., to gap fill missing data) Photosynthetically Active Radiation (PAR). Observations are made by sensors at the soil surface covering a one meter length.

Name: Temporally interpolated photosynthetically active radiation
Description: Temporally interpolated (i.e., to gap fill missing data) Photosynthetically Active Radiation (PAR). Observations are made by sensors located at multiple heights on the tower infrastructure and a single sensor located on the aquatic meteorology station.

Name: Temporally interpolated shortwave and longwave radiation (net radiometer)
Description: Temporally interpolated (i.e., to gap fill missing data) net radiation that is composed of incoming and outgoing shortwave and longwave radiation. These data products are available as one- and thirty-minute averages from sensors located on the TIS tower and located on the aquatic meteorology station.

Name: Temporally interpolated soil temperature
Description: Temporally interpolated (i.e., to gap fill missing data) soil temperature at various depth below the soil surface from 2 cm up to 200 cm at non-permafrost sites (up to 300 cm at Alaskan sites). Data are from all five Instrumented Soil Plots per site and presented as 1-minute and 30-minute averages.

Name: Temporally interpolated triple aspirated tower temperature
Description: Temporally interpolated (i.e. to gap fill missing data) air temperature, derived from triplicate 1 Hz temperature observations. Observations are made by sensors located at the top of the tower infrastructure. Temperature observations are made by three platinum resistance thermometers, which are housed together in a fan aspirated shield to reduce radiative biases.

Name: Tick-borne pathogen status
Description: Presence/absence of a pathogen in each single tick sample

Name: Ticks sampled using drag cloths
Description: Abundance and density of ticks collected by drag and/or flag sampling (by species and/or lifestage)

Name: Total biomass map - spectrometer - flightline
Description: Mass of all above ground organic matter per unit area at particular time; estimate of  biomass derived from correlation with NDVI and LAI parameters; data are provided by flightline data are provided by flightline at equivalent resolution to spectrometer orthorectified surface directional reflectance.

Name: Total biomass map - spectrometer - mosaic
Description: Mass of all aboveground organic matter per unit area at particular time; estimate of biomass derived from correlation with NDVI and LAI parameters; mosaicked from the total biomass level 2 product onto a spatially uniform grid at 1 m spatial resolution and provided as 1 km by 1 km tiles.

Name: Triple aspirated air temperature
Description: Air temperature, available as one- and thirty-minute averages derived from triplicate 1 Hz temperature observations. Observations are made by sensors located at the top of the tower infrastructure. Temperature observations are made by three platinum resistance thermometers, which are housed together in a fan aspirated shield to reduce radiative biases.

Name: Vegetation indices - spectrometer - flightline
Description: NDVI - Normalized ratio of NIR and IR bands; characterizes the \"red edge" in vegetation spectra. SAVI - Normalized ratio of 850 nm and 650 nm bands with gain and offset factors to minimize soil contribution in result; primary input to LAI product. EVI - Normalized ratio of NIR and IR bans (red edge characterization); includes Blue channel for better aerosol characterization. Data are provided by flightline; additional indices will be assessed and added to this product

Name: Vegetation indices - spectrometer - mosaic
Description: NDVI - Normalized ratio of NIR and IR bands; characterizes the \"red edge" in vegetation spectra. SAVI - Normalized ratio of 850 nm and 650 nm bands with gain and offset factors to minimize soil contribution in result; primary input to LAI product. EVI - Normalized ratio of NIR and IR bans (red edge characterization); includes Blue channel for better aerosol characterization.  Level 2 products derived from individual flight lines over a given site are mosaicked into single product; spatial resolution is 1m.

Name: Water quality
Description: In situ sensor-based specific conductivity, concentration of chlorophyll a, dissolved oxygen content, fDOM concentration, pH, and turbidity, available as one- or five-minute instantaneous measurements in surface water of lakes, wadeable streams, and non-wadeable streams.

Name: Water temperature and conductivity in lakes from subsurface moored array of sensors
Description: Measurements of water temperature and conductivity in lakes from subsurface moored array of sensors. Temperature and conductivity are measured at specific depths, which are monitored via a pressure transducer. The subsurface mooring enables continuous winter monitoring beneath ice at frozen lake sites.

Name: Wet deposition chemical analysis
Description: Total dissolved chemical ion concentrations of sulfate (SO4 2-), nitrate (NO3-), chloride (Cl-), bromide (Br-), ammonium (NH4+), phosphate (PO4 3-), calcium (Ca2+), magnesium (Mg2+), potassium (K+), sodium (Na+), and pH/Conductivity in precipitation water; collected at TIS and AIS sites.

Name: Windspeed and direction above water on-buoy
Description: Wind speed and direction; observations are made by 2-D sonic anemometer sensors located on lake and river buoys.

Name: Woody plant vegetation structure
Description: Structure measurements, including height, canopy diameter, and stem diameter, as well as mapped position of individual woody plants

Name: Zooplankton collection
Description: Collection of zooplankton from water column samples in lakes

Name: Zooplankton metabarcoding
Description: CO1 DNA sequences of the zooplankton community
